com.percussion.util
Class PSPurgableTempFile

java.lang.Object
  java.io.File
      com.percussion.util.PSPurgableTempFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<File>
public class PSPurgableTempFile
extends File

This class is used to create a temporary file which is deleted when it is garbage collected. Consider to use PSPurgableFileInputStream if need to delete the file upon closing the input stream.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tas Giakouminakis
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

PSPurgableTempFile

public PSPurgableTempFile(String prefix,
                          String suffix,
                          File dir)
                   throws IOException
Convenience constructor that calls PSPurgableTempFile(prefix, suffix, dir, null, null, null).

Throws:
IOException

PSPurgableTempFile

public PSPurgableTempFile(String prefix,
                          String suffix,
                          File dir,
                          String sourceFile,
                          String contentType,
                          String encType)
                   throws IOException
Construct a purgable temp file storing additional information about the source.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix to use for the temp file name, must be at least 3 characters.
suffix - the suffix to use for the temp file name, may be null to use the default .tmp.
dir - the directory to create the file in, may be null to use the default temp dir.
sourceFile - the fully qualified path if the source of this tempfile is a file. May be null or zero length if the source is not a file or not known.
contentType - the type of content the source, may be null. The character set is often defined in the content type string.
encType - the method used to encode this file, may be null if this is a binary file or if the encoding is not known. This is not the character set encoding for the file.
Throws:
IOException - if any IO operation fails.
Method Detail

getSourceFileName

public String getSourceFileName()
Returns the name of the source file of this file, or null if it is not known.

Returns:
the content type as a string

getSourceContentType

public String getSourceContentType()
Returns the content type of the source file of this file, or null if it is not known.

Returns:
the content type as a string

getTransferEncoding

public String getTransferEncoding()
Returns the name of the encoding scheme (the content-transfer-encoding, not charset encoding) used to create this file, or null if the encoding is not known.

Returns:
the transfer encoding scheme if known; null otherwise

getCharacterSetEncoding

public String getCharacterSetEncoding()
Returns the name of the character set used to encode this text file, or null if this is a binary file or if the encoding is not known.

Returns:
the encoding type as a string

release

public void release()
Deletes the file if exists. This method should be called after the file is no longer needed.

finalize

protected void finalize()
                 throws Throwable
Overriding the finalizer to delete the file.

Overrides:
finalize in class Object
Throws:
